podcast_summary: In his TEDx talk, journalist and consultant Bob Wilkfong discusses the prevalence of business speak, also known as BS, in the workplace. He explains that business speak is a language used to describe and define things in a professional setting, but it can often be confusing and exclusionary. Wilkfong points out that the majority of people creating and speaking this language are white males, reflecting the historical dominance of white men in the business world. He suggests three ways to remove the BS from business speak: using BS to be inclusive, expressing ideas without cliches and jargon, and recognizing the potential for BS to get lost in translation. By doing so, workplaces can foster better communication and create a more inclusive environment.
